prompt: Which is heavier, a pound of bricks or two pounds of feathers?
response: Thank you for asking! Both a pound of bricks and two pounds of feathers weigh the same amount, 2 pounds. The confusion may arise from the fact that bricks are much denser than feathers, meaning that a smaller volume of bricks will weigh more than a larger volume of feathers. However, when comparing two equal volumes of the same substance, their weight is the same. So, in this case, a pound of bricks and two pounds of feathers are indeed the same weight.
